Title: Access current Instance uuid in PowerShell script
Content:
To get the Instance uuid of the current Task during script runtime as a string variable, add this method to very first line of the script: ROBOCODE0 Then you can access the Instance uuid within the script using the following method: ROBOCODE1 This will get a string variable like fbfa8388-7a23-46a9-a318-7f86f4b96955.
To access Robogator proprietary variables with PowerShell, you have to first initialize all variables on the first line of the script and after that it is possible to access the variables in the underlaying script lines.
